name: picketed
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
picket
to act as or take part in a picket: They picketed the burger restaurant and handed out leaflets to potential customers. He was not surprised when his office was picketed.
More examplesFewer examplesDemonstrators picketed and chanted outside the company's annual meeting.More than 100 protesters picketed the hotel on Saturday as part of a nationwide boycott.Workers had picketed at the plant for more than two weeks, mainly over health-care costs.
